       Introduced  by  Sen.  DIAZ  --  read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to creating the mature  work-
         ers support program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The elder law is amended by adding a new article 3 to  read
    2  as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE III
    4                       MATURE WORKERS SUPPORT PROGRAM
    5  SECTION 301. MATURE WORKERS SUPPORT PROGRAM.
    6    S  301.  MATURE  WORKERS  SUPPORT  PROGRAM.  1.  THE  OFFICE SHALL, IN
    7  CONJUNCTION WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, DEVELOP AND UPDATE ON AN ANNU-
    8  AL BASIS A GUIDE FOR BUSINESSES FOR HIRING,  RETAINING,  AND  RETRAINING
    9  MATURE WORKERS IN NEW YORK STATE.
   10    2.   SUCH GUIDE SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITES OF THE OFFICE,
   11  DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, AND DEPARTMENT OF  STATE.  BUSINESSES  THAT  OBTAIN
   12  CERTIFICATION OR LICENSURE FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR OR DEPARTMENT OF
   13  STATE  SHALL BE PROVIDED WITH A LINK TO THIS GUIDE, OR A PAPER COPY UPON
   14  REQUEST, WHEN THEY APPLY FOR SUCH CERTIFICATION OR LICENSURE. A  REASON-
   15  ABLE FEE MAY BE CHARGED FOR PAPER COPIES PROVIDED TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE
   16  NOT BUSINESS OWNERS.
   17    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2396

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the elder law, in relation to creating the mature workers
support program

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
To develop a guide for businesses regarding the hiring, retaining and
retraining of mature workers in New York State.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1. Amends the Elder Law by adding a news article 3. Directs
the office for aging and the department of labor to develop and
update on an annual basis, a mature workers' guide for businesses in
New York State.

Section 2. Outlines the manner in which this guidebook will be made
available.

Section 3. Effective Date.

EXISTING LAW:
None.

JUSTIFICATION:
Workers in NY State are working longer than ever due to the recession
of 2009. It is important that the State assist these mature workers
and business's age friendly working environments. Therefore, it is
the intent of this bill to have the state office of the aging and the
department of labor develop a guide for businesses that will assist
them in attaining the goals outlined in section 301 of the elder law.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2011:      Senate-New Bill/A.472A - Amend and Recommit to Aging
2009-2010: A.9866- Referred to Ways and Means

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Minimal, however paper copies of this guide will be made available to
consumers for a fee.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
